_documentation:
Might be problems with Mikrotik. Also checked:
 - That type is Ethernet
- That interfaces is not in down status (issue on HP Procurve). Since 6 is also ethernet in if_arp.h - this trigger can also be used in Linux non SNMP templates for now.
expression:
{TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.change()}<0 and {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.last()}>0
and (
{TEMPLATE_NAME:__net.if.type__.last()}=6 or
{TEMPLATE_NAME:__net.if.type__.last()}=7 or
{TEMPLATE_NAME:__net.if.type__.last()}=11 or
{TEMPLATE_NAME:__net.if.type__.last()}=62 or
{TEMPLATE_NAME:__net.if.type__.last()}=69 or
{TEMPLATE_NAME:__net.if.type__.last()}=117
)
and
({TEMPLATE_NAME:__net.if.status__.last()}<>2)
name: Ethernet has changed to lower speed than it was before
description: This Ethernet connection has transitioned down from its known maximum speed. This might be a sign of autonegotiation issues. Ack to close.

RU.name: Интерфейс перешел на более низкую скорость, чем был ранее
